description: Unique surrogate key for the purchase order attribute definition; primary key used for reference and joins.
User-facing label displayed for the attribute on PO screens, forms, or reports; configurable by administrators.
Brief explanation of the attribute’s business meaning or usage, supporting help text and documentation.
Code indicating the attribute’s data type (e.g., text, number, date); values map to a type catalog; confirm with SME.
Maximum length, precision, or scale allowed for the attribute’s value; may be null when not applicable.
Boolean-like flag indicating whether the attribute must be provided when entering a PO; confirm value mapping with SME.
Meaning unclear; likely flags system-defined versus custom attribute, or enables special validation/behavior; confirm with SME.
Unit associated with numeric attribute values (e.g., miles, hours, currency); blank when not applicable.
Value prefilled for the attribute on new records when no user input is provided.
Sequence number controlling the attribute’s display position relative to other PO attributes.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this attribute definition, used for auditing and synchronization.
Free-text notes or rationale about this attribute definition for administrators and auditors.
Field meaning ambiguous; values appear as timestamps, likely the time of last user-initiated change; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user or process that created this attribute definition; used for audit trail.
Timestamp when the attribute definition was initially created.
Identifier of the user or process that last updated the attribute definition.
Timestamp when the attribute definition was last changed.
